conclusion: Analyze electric field and potential at center O before and after placing charge at C.
Points A, B, and C form an equilateral triangle with equal-magnitude like charges at A and B.
Electric field at center O due to charges at A and B is E.
Electric potential at center O is unspecified but can be calculated.
Electric fields from A and B at O have equal magnitudes but opposite directions.
Electric field due to a single charge q at distance r is E_q = kq/r^2.
Total electric field at O is E_total = sqrt(3)kq/r^2.
Given total electric field E = sqrt(3)kq/r^2.
Electric potential due to single charge q at distance r is V_q = kq/r.
Total electric potential at O is V_total = 2kq/r.
Electric field due to charge at C is E_C = -kq/r^2.
New total electric field at O is E_new = E(1 - 1/sqrt(3)).
Electric potential due to charge at C is V_C = -kq/r.
New total electric potential at O is V_new = kq/r.
Final electric field strength at O is E(sqrt(3) - 1)/sqrt(3).
Final electric potential at O is kq/r.
